definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: The thugs gave him a thorough going-over.
The terrorists dragged her into a dark room and duffed her up.
sentences.chinese: 那些恐怖分子把她拖進一間黑暗的房間毒打了一頓。

sentences.english: He suffered a perforated eardrum after being beaten and is now partially deaf.
sentences.chinese: 他在被毒打之後導致耳膜穿孔，目前已經半聾。

sentences.english: The poor dog was always maltreated by its master.
sentences.chinese: 那可憐的狗總是被它的主人毒打。

sentences.english: He beat up on her bad.
Some reports say beatings from family members resulted in a broken pelvis.
sentences.chinese: 一些報道稱家庭成員的毒打使她一旁骨盆開裂。

sentences.english: Failure to greet him always after the rainstorm of beating his wife.
sentences.chinese: 失敗而歸後，迎接他的總是老婆的那場暴雨般的毒打。

sentences.english: The serf was beaten up by her owner and passed out for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 這位農奴挨農奴主毒打，昏迷了兩個小時。

sentences.english: They beat her so badly, she almost died.
sentences.chinese: 於是她又遭到了毒打，差點就死掉了。

sentences.english: He had been beaten up and rolled.
sentences.chinese: 他受到毒打併被翻來轉去地搜遍全身搶盡財物。

sentences.english: Sumou of beating things, Lin and 3 per confessed.
sentences.chinese: 對毒打蘇某的事情，林某等3人均供認不諱。

sentences.english: Sailors have been tied up, beaten with rifle butts, and whipped with electrical cables.
sentences.chinese: 海員們被捆綁起來，用步槍座毒打，用通電纜線抽打。

sentences.english: After the beatings on the third day, the young man thought he might die.
sentences.chinese: 在遭受了三天的毒打之後，年輕人以爲他自己會死掉。

sentences.english: He and the other goon began to beat me up.
sentences.chinese: 他和另外一個暴徒開始毒打我。

definition: lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
